questions.question_text: When a RADAR operator says the following to an aircraft: 'fly heading 030', the pilot must fly heading:
options: 030° magnetic in still air conditions (thereby flying the magnetic track)
030° true, in still air conditions (thereby flying the true track)
questions.explanation: When ATC gives a heading instruction, it's always in magnetic heading unless specified otherwise.

questions.question_text: At night an aircraft observes a luminous signal requesting help. To indicate that he has received these ground signals, the pilot must:
options: make at least one complete turn over the group of people in difficulty
transmit, by luminous Morse signal, a series of the letter 'R' using his navigational lights.
switch his landing lights on and off twice or, if he is not so equipped, his navigation lights twice.
fly over the group of people in difficulty as low as possible.
questions.solution: switch his landing lights on and off twice or, if he is not so equipped, his navigation lights twice.
questions.explanation: This is the standard visual signal to acknowledge receipt of a distress signal from the ground.

questions.question_text: What airplane equipment marked a substantial decrease in hull loss rates in the eighties?
questions.explanation: Ground Proximity Warning System (GPWS) significantly reduced controlled flight into terrain (CFIT) accidents.

questions.question_text: Rods (scotopic visual cells) allow for:
options: good night-vision after adaptation to darkness (30 min)
precise vision of contours and colours
red vision, both during the day and at night
questions.explanation: Rods are responsible for night vision but require time to adapt to darkness.

questions.question_text: With regard to central vision, which of the following statements are correct? 1: It is due to the functioning of rods 2: It enables details, colours and movement to be seen 3: Its very active both during the day and at night 4: It represents a zone where about 150,000 cones per mm are located to give high resolution capacity
questions.explanation: Central vision is primarily cone-based, enabling detailed and color vision, with high cone density for resolution.

questions.question_text: The trend in airplane hull-loss rate over the last three decades seems to be related to:
questions.explanation: Human factors, particularly crew performance, have been a significant factor in aviation safety improvements.

questions.question_text: The hailstones occur from
questions.explanation: Hail forms in cumulonimbus clouds where there are strong updrafts and temperatures are below freezing.

questions.question_text: A flashing intermittent red light directed from the ground to an aircraft in flight indicates:
options: Continue the circuit and make another approach
Execute a go-around and do not land
Aerodrome is unsafe, landing is prohibited
Maintain current altitude and wait for further instructions
questions.explanation: A flashing red light from the ground indicates that the aerodrome is unsafe, and landing is prohibited.

questions.question_text: OCH for a precision approach is defined as:
options: The lowest height above mean sea level of the relevant runway used in establishing
The lowest altitude above the aerodrome elevation used in establishing compliance with appropriate obstacle clearance requirements
The lowest height above the elevation of the relevant runway threshold, at which a missed approach must be initiated to ensure compliance with the appropriate obstacle clearance criteria
questions.explanation: OCH (Obstacle Clearance Height) is defined as the lowest height above the aerodrome elevation used in establishing compliance with appropriate obstacle clearance requirements.

questions.question_text: A applicant for the licences shall have the ability to speak and understand the English language used for radiotelephony communications to the level of proficiency specified by the Director General.
options: PPL, CPL, ATPL, FIt Navigator and Fit Engg
questions.explanation: English language proficiency is required for PPL, CPL, ATPL, Flight Navigator, and Flight Engineer licenses.

questions.question_text: In order to meet the wake turbulence criteria, what minimum separation should be applied when a MEDIUM aircraft is taking off behind a HEAVY aircraft and both are using the same runway?
questions.explanation: A 2-minute separation is required for a MEDIUM aircraft taking off behind a HEAVY aircraft on the same runway.

questions.question_text: Prisoners can be carried on board with the permission of:
questions.explanation: The Director General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) is the authority that grants permission for carrying prisoners on board.

questions.question_text: Wake turbulence will be greatest when generated by an aeroplane which is:
options: Heavy, landing configuration and slow speed
Heavy, clean configuration and slow speed
Light, clean configuration and high speed
questions.explanation: Wake turbulence is most significant with heavy aircraft in clean configuration at slow speeds, such as during takeoff or approach.

questions.question_text: The aircraft commander, when he has reasonable grounds to believe that a person has committed or is about to commit, on board the aircraft, an offense against penal law:
options: Can not authorize the assistance of other crew members.
Can not request for the assistance of passengers to restrain such persons.
May deliver such person to the competent authorities.
questions.explanation: The aircraft commander has the authority to deliver offenders to competent authorities upon landing.

questions.question_text: OCA/OCH is measured with respect to:
questions.explanation: OCA (Obstacle Clearance Altitude/Height) is measured with respect to the threshold or Aerodrome Reference Point (ARP).

questions.question_text: Max age for foreign license?
questions.explanation: The maximum age for holding a foreign license is typically 65 years.

questions.question_text: In case of RCF you must land at the destination aerodrome within
questions.explanation: In case of Radio Communication Failure (RCF), the aircraft must land within 30 minutes of the Estimated Approach Time (EAT).

questions.question_text: What do we fill in Flight plan if meteorological conditions at destination is not available/below AOM?
questions.explanation: When meteorological conditions at the destination are not available or below AOM, two alternate aerodromes must be specified in the flight plan.

questions.question_text: To identify you on radar ATC doesn't ask your
questions.explanation: ATC typically doesn't ask for VOR radial for identification; they would use transponder codes (squawk) or other radar identification methods.

questions.question_text: ICAO annexure 2 applies to ...
questions.explanation: ICAO Annex 2 (Rules of the Air) applies to both IFR and VFR flights.
